{{Primary sources|date=July 2014}} {{Infobox musical artist <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Musicians --> | name = +1 Music | image = | caption = +1 Music | image_size = | background = group_or_band | alias = | origin = New York, NY/San Francisco, CA | genre = independent, alternative | years_active = 2004- | associated_companies = +1 Records | website = www.plusonemusic.net | founders = }}
'''+1 Music''' was founded in 2004 as a management and public relations company. The company now offers direct-to-fan online and social network marketing.<ref name=plusonemusic>{{cite web|url=http://www.plusonemusic.net/#!/about |title=About |work=Evolution |accessdate=21 February 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/65gB5dNpM?url=http://plusonemusic.net/ |archivedate=24 February 2012 |deadurl=no |df= }}</ref>
In 2008 the company launched [[+1 records|+1 Records]].
==Members== [[Ambulance LTD]], [[Atlas Genius]], [[Basement Jaxx]], [[The Boy Least Likely To]], [[The Brighton Port Authority#The Brighton Port Authority|The BPA]], Caveman, [[The Cribs]], [[Editors (band)|Editors]], [[Frankie and The Heartstrings|Frankie & The Heartstrings]], [[The Heavy (band)|The Heavy]], [[Illinois (band)|Illinois]], [[Jamie T]], [[Kate Nash]], [[The Kooks]], [[Lissie]], [[The Morning Benders|the morning benders]], [[The Postelles]], [[Stellastar|stellastarr*]], [[Tv on the radio|TV On The Radio]], [[Two Gallants (band)|Two Gallants]], [[White Lies band|White Lies]] <ref name=autogenerated1>{{cite web|url=http://www.plusonemusic.net/#!/about |title=Clients |work=Clients |accessdate=21 February 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/65gB5dNpM?url=http://plusonemusic.net/ |archivedate=24 February 2012 |deadurl=no |df= }}</ref>
Diesel-U-Music, JELLY, Lebowski Fest, Playboy Rock the Rabbit, Future Sounds, The US Air Guitar Championships

{{Use mdy dates|date=August 2016}} {{Infobox film | name = 1 | image = 1 (2013 film poster).jpg | alt = | caption = Film poster | film name = | director = [[Paul Crowder (filmmaker)|Paul Crowder]] | producer = Michael Shevloff
Nigel Sinclair | writer = Mark Monroe | screenplay = Mark Monroe | story = | based on = | starring = | narrator = [[Michael Fassbender]] | music = Matter | cinematography = | editing = | studio = Spitfire Pictures
Flat-Out Films
Diamond Docs | distributor = Exclusive Media | released = {{Film date|2013|10|1|US}} | runtime = 112 minutes | country = United States | language = English | budget = | gross = }} '''''1''''' (also known as '''''1: Life On The Limit''''') is a 2013 [[documentary film]] directed by [[Paul Crowder (filmmaker)|Paul Crowder]] and narrated by [[Michael Fassbender]]. The film traces the history of [[Formula One]] auto racing from its early years, in which some seasons had multiple fatalities, to the 1994 death of [[Ayrton Senna]], the sport's most recent death at the time of production.{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/men/the-filter/10561339/Life-On-The-Limit-Formula-Ones-deadliest-crashes.html|title=Life On The Limit: Formula One's deadliest crashes|accessdate=June 4, 2014|date=January 10, 2014|author=Johnson, Daniel|work=[[The Daily Telegraph|The Telegraph]]}}{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2014/jan/12/1-life-on-the-limit-mark-kermode-review|title=1 – Life on the Limit – review|accessdate=June 4, 2014|date=January 11, 2014|author=Kermode, Mark|work=[[The Guardian]]}} Extensive and often rare archival footage is used throughout. ==Synopsis== The film opens with the [[1996 Australian Grand Prix]] in [[Melbourne]], where [[Martin Brundle]] survived a spectacular crash at turn 3. After receiving clearance from race doctor [[Sid Watkins]], Brundle hopped into a spare car to finish the race. The film then takes a brief look at the early days of Formula One racing in the 1950s, which was essentially a resumption of prewar Grand Prix racing. In 1958, the year world champion [[Juan Manuel Fangio]] retired, the [[Fédération Internationale de l'Automobile|FIA]] announced the [[List of Formula One World Constructors' Champions|Formula One World Constructors' Championship]] for the makers of the winning car. This led to a wave of British privateer teams, nicknamed "''Garagistas''" by [[Enzo Ferrari]], dominating the Championship. Most notable was [[Team Lotus]], led by [[Colin Chapman]].Chapman's innovative designs and the talent of Jim Clark saw the team becoming influential in the evolving Formula One development. In 1966, the FIA doubled the engine size from [[Engine displacement|1.5 to 3 liters]], which saw the cars race markedly faster on tracks and facilities unchanged since before World War II. This resulted in several fatal accidents. The death of Chapman's star driver [[Jim Clark]] at the [[Hockenheimring]] in a [[Formula Two]] race in 1968{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/onthisday/hi/dates/stories/april/7/newsid_2837000/2837559.stm |title=BBC On This Day 7 April |author= |website=[[bbc.co.uk]] |access-date=June 5, 2016}} was a turning point: several drivers, including Clark's Lotus replacement, [[Jochen Rindt]], and the [[Grand Prix Drivers' Association]] (GPDA), began questioning the sport's safety. Rindt himself was killed during practice at the [[1970 Italian Grand Prix]]; he was posthumously awarded the driver's championship that year. [[Jackie Stewart]], three-time champion and Chairman of the GPDA, used his position to push for improved safety and track facilities, including safety barriers and mandatory seat belts. This caused some opposition with other drivers, most notably [[Jacky Ickx]], Stewart's opponent on the track at the time. Stewart's influence led to boycotts of some races, including the 1971 Belgian Grand Prix. Despite his efforts, drivers continued to be killed, including Stewart's own teammate, [[François Cevert]], at the [[1973 United States Grand Prix]]. Meanwhile, new drivers and teams made their way into Formula One. [[Hesketh Racing]], led by the extravagant [[Alexander Fermor-Hesketh, 3rd Baron Hesketh|Lord Hesketh]], entered Formula One in 1973 with their [[Formula Two]] driver [[James Hunt]]. Despite their rather blasé appearance, they performed surprisingly well including winning the [[1975 Dutch Grand Prix]] ahead of [[Scuderia Ferrari|Ferrari]]'s [[Niki Lauda]]. When Hesketh was forced to close at the end of 1975, Hunt went to McLaren, which placed both him and Lauda as favorites to win the [[1976 Formula One season|1976]] Championship. The 1976 season was dramatic, for Lauda led for the first half, but Hunt gained ground on Lauda despite being disqualified from two races (the [[1976 Spanish Grand Prix|Spanish Grand Prix]] victory was later reinstated). Lauda almost died from a fiery accident at the [[1976 German Grand Prix|German Grand Prix]] at the notorious [[Nürburgring]], but managed to keep his championship alive by taking fourth at the [[1976 Italian Grand Prix|Italian Grand Prix]] almost a month after his accident. At the last race at a rain-soaked [[1976 Japanese Grand Prix|Japanese Grand Prix]], Lauda voluntarily retired from the race, allowing Hunt to win the championship by finishing third. In 1978, [[Bernie Ecclestone]], head of the [[Formula One Constructors Association]], hired Professor Sid Watkins as the official Formula One 'race doctor.' Initially distrusted by track officials, Watkins' influence on the sport increased after the death of [[Ronnie Peterson]] at the [[1978 Italian Grand Prix]]; at that race, the Italian officials prevented him from treating Peterson at the scene.Watkins was later named President of a Formula One Medical Commission in 1981, which implemented permanent on-track medical facilities amongst other medical advancements. Following Peterson's accident, Formula One remained relatively fatality free until the [[1994 San Marino Grand Prix]], which saw the deaths of [[Roland Ratzenberger]] and [[Ayrton Senna]] in separate accidents. In the aftermath, the FIA President [[Max Mosley]] (who drove in the race Jim Clark was killed in, and was head of [[March Engineering]] in the 1970s), formed the Advisory Expert Group chaired by Sid Watkins to research and improve safety in motor racing. As a result of the changes implemented by this Group, Formula One did not experience a driver fatality until 2015, when driver [[Jules Bianchi]] succumbed to a head injury 9 months after a crash during the [[2014 Japanese Grand Prix]].{{cite web|url=http://www.autosport.com/news/report.php/id/120021|title=Jules Bianchi dies nine months after crash in Japanese F1 GP|date=July 18, 2015|work=AUTOSPORT.com|accessdate=July 18, 2015}} ==Featured cast== ===Interviewees=== {{div col|colwidth=30em}} *[[Mario Andretti]] *[[John Barnard]] *Jane Birbeck *[[Herbie Blash]] *[[Martin Brundle]] *[[Jenson Button]] *[[Ron Dennis]] *[[Bernie Ecclestone]] *[[Emerson Fittipaldi]] *[[Lewis Hamilton]] *[[Alexander Fermor-Hesketh, 3rd Baron Hesketh|Lord Hesketh]] *Brigitte Hill *[[Damon Hill]] *Freddie Hunt *[[Jacky Ickx]] *[[Eddie Jordan]] *[[Niki Lauda]] *[[Brett Lunger]] *[[Nigel Mansell]] *[[John Miles (racing driver)|John Miles]] *[[Max Mosley]] *[[Jody Scheckter]] *[[Michael Schumacher]] *[[Jackie Stewart]] *Sally Stewart *[[John Surtees]] *[[Sebastian Vettel]] *[[Sid Watkins]] *[[John Watson (racing driver)|John Watson]] {{div col end}} ===Archive footage=== *[[François Cevert]] *[[Colin Chapman]] *[[Jim Clark]] *[[Enzo Ferrari]] *Bette Hill *[[James Hunt]] *[[Grace Kelly|Princess Grace of Monaco]] *[[Bruce McLaren]] *[[Jochen Rindt]] *[[Ayrton Senna]] ==Production== Crowder had the idea for creating a "safety documentary" about Formula One racing in the 1980s, though production did not begin until 2008.{{cite web |url=http://www.carmagazine.co.uk/News/Search-Results/First-Official-Pictures/1-Life-On-The-Limit-2014-CAR-film-review/|title='1: Life On The Limit' (2014) CAR film review|first=Ollie|last=Kew|date=January 20, 2014|accessdate=September 6, 2014|work=[[Car (magazine)|Car Magazine]]}} In addition to narration by Michael Fassbender, the documentary features on-screen interviews with Formula One champions [[Mario Andretti]], [[Jenson Button]], [[Lewis Hamilton]], [[Damon Hill]], [[Jacky Ickx]], [[Niki Lauda]], [[Nigel Mansell]], [[Michael Schumacher]], [[Jackie Stewart]], and [[Sebastian Vettel]].{{cite web |url=http://www.contactmusic.com/movie-review/1-life-on-the-limit|title=1: Life on the Limit Movie Review |first=Rich|last=Cline|year=2014|accessdate=September 6, 2014|work=[[Contactmusic.com]]}}{{cite web |url=https://www.nytimes.com/movies/movie/461800/One-Life-On-The-Limit/cast|title=One: Life On The Limit – Acting Credits|publisher=[[The New York Times]]|year=2010|accessdate=September 6, 2014}} Other interviewees include [[Bernie Ecclestone]], head of the [[Formula One Constructors Association]] (FOCA), [[Max Mosley]], legal adviser to FOCA, and [[Sid Watkins]], head of the Formula One on-track medical team. The majority of the interviews were completed in 2010 and 2011. ==Release== The documentary premiered on January 10, 2014 at the [[Empire, Leicester Square]] in [[London]], [[United Kingdom]].{{cite web|url=http://www.formula1.com/news/headlines/2014/1/15370.html|title='1' documentary set for London opening|accessdate=June 4, 2014|date=January 11, 2014|work=[[Formula One]]}} The sport suffered its first fatality in 2015 as a result of a 2014 accident when [[Jules Bianchi]] died on July 17, 2015.{{cite web|url=http://espn.go.com/racing/f1/story/_/id/13276268/jules-bianchi-french-formula-one-driver-dies-injuries-sustained-2014-crash|title=Jules Bianchi dies from injuries suffered in 2014 Japanese GP crash|publisher=[[ESPN]]|date=July 18, 2015|accessdate=July 29, 2015|agency=[[Associated Press]]}}{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/formula1/33578770|title=Jules Bianchi: F1 driver dies from Suzuka crash injuries|work=[[BBC.com]]|date=July 18, 2015|accessdate=July 29, 2015}} ===Home media=== ''1'' was released on DVD and Blu-ray on January 28, 2014 in the United States and Canada{{cite web|url=http://www.dvdsreleasedates.com/movies/6647/1|title=1 (2013)|accessdate=August 29, 2014|publisher=DVDReleaseDates.com}} and on March 17 in the United Kingdom.{{cite web|url=http://www.blu-ray.com/news/?id=12876|title=1: Life On The Limit Blu-ray|accessdate=August 29, 2014|date=December 20, 2013|publisher=Blu-ray.com}} The Australian Blu-ray release and some DVDs are bundled with ''[[Rush (2013 film)|Rush]]''.{{cite web |url=http://www.blu-ray.com/movies/Rush-and-1-Double-Pack-Blu-ray/118307/ |title=Rush / 1: Double Pack Blu-ray |publisher=Blu-ray.com |accessdate=May 18, 2016}} ==Critical reception== Mike McCahill of ''[[The Guardian]]'' gave the documentary 4 stars out of 5, stating, "This F1 history finds its narrative impetus in the trade-off between crowd pleasing speed and concern for driver survival".{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2014/jan/09/1-life-on-the-limit-review|title=1: Life on the Limit – review|accessdate=July 30, 2014|date=January 9, 2014|work=[[The Guardian]]|author=McCahill, Mike}} McCahill praised the timing and contextual presentation, and described the film as "surprisingly critical." [[Mark Kermode]] of ''[[The Guardian]]'' found "gripping" the mixture of archive footage and modern-day interviews. [[Daniel Johnson (journalist)|Daniel Johnson]] of ''[[The Daily Telegraph|The Telegraph]]'' considered the film a "compelling" depiction, noting that Formula One racing went beyond "sport" to "high-stakes theatre" in the fifteen years following 1967, a period in which 19 drivers died. Charlotte O'Sullivan of the ''[[London Evening Standard]]'' described the movie as "pure bliss for Formula 1 fans."{{cite web|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/goingout/film/life-on-the-limit--film-review-9050938.html|title=Life on the Limit – film review: Michael Fassbender narrates the story of Formula 1|accessdate=September 2, 2014|date=January 10, 2014|author=O'Sullivan, Charlotte|work=[[London Evening Standard]]}} The film's star power was highlighted by [[Ian Freer]] of ''[[Empire (film magazine)|Empire]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.empireonline.com/reviews/reviewcomplete.asp?FID=138446|title=1: Life On The Limit: Formula 1 documentary|accessdate=September 2, 2014|date=|author=Freer, Ian|work=[[Empire (film magazine)|Empire]]}} ''[[The Independent]]'' described the film as "well-researched", but noted its "morbid" and "depressing" elements.{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/reviews/1-life-on-the-limit-12a--film-review-9049855.html|title=1: Life On The Limit (12A) – film review|accessdate=September 2, 2014|date=January 9, 2014|author=|work=[[The Independent]]}} [[Bleacher Report]] featured columnist Matthew Walthert described the film as an inspiring tragedy told by the living about those who died while quickly driving high-powered and potentially lethal "mobile bombs." The Independent notes the film graphically documents the improvement of safety in the sport.{{cite web|url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/1920946-1-life-on-the-limit-a-review-of-the-new-formula-1-documentary|title='1: Life on the Limit': A Review of the New Formula 1 Documentary|accessdate=September 2, 2014|date=January 13, 2014|publisher=[[Bleacher Report]]|author=Walthert, Matthew}} Fassbender's narration was described as both "sonorous" and "laconic". Ecclestone and Mosley were lauded by reviewers for their "genuine determination" and for their roles as "self-styled guardian angels". Kermode noted the timing of the film, which opened in the shadow of ''[[Senna (film)|Senna]]'' (2010) and ''Rush'' (2013). The film is praised for complementing them both. ''The Independent'' described the film as produced alongside ''Rush''. Walthert claimed the film was a response to ''Senna'', which "raised the bar for F1 filmmaking" as much as its predecessor. The archival footage is said to be familiar to viewers of those films, but it is said to be "moving" and "smartly marshalled". British ''[[GQ]]'' critic Rebecca Cox described the footage as "100 per cent real and utterly terrifying".{{cite web|url=http://www.gq-magazine.co.uk/entertainment/articles/2014-01/16/life-on-the-limit-film-review|title=Survival of the fastest|accessdate=September 2, 2014|date=January 16, 2014|work=British [[GQ]]|author=Cox, Rebecca|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924041755/http://www.gq-magazine.co.uk/entertainment/articles/2014-01/16/life-on-the-limit-film-review|archive-date=September 24, 2015|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}} ==References== ===Notes=== {{Reflist|group=upper-alpha}} ===Citations=== {{reflist|30em}} ==External links== * {{IMDb title|2518788|1}} * {{Rotten Tomatoes|771363931|1}} * {{AllMovie title|587342|1}} [[Category:2010s documentary films]] [[Category:2010s sports films]] [[Category:American films]] [[Category:American documentary films]] [[Category:American sports films]] [[Category:Documentary films about auto racing]] [[Category:English-language films]] [[Category:Formula One media]]

{{Use mdy dates|date=June 2018}} {{Year nav topic5|2014|Philippine television}} The following is a list of events affecting '''Philippine television in 2014'''. Events listed include television show debuts, finales, cancellations, and channel launches, closures and rebrandings, as well as information about controversies and carriage disputes.
==Events==
===January=== * January 1 – [[ABS-CBN (TV network)|ABS-CBN]] officially launches a new logo thru the year-long campaign ''Masayang Muli Ang Kwento Natin''. * January 16 – After 17 years of broadcast, [[Studio 23]] ended its commercial operations on Thursday evening.<ref name="Reuben Terrado">{{cite web | url=http://www.spin.ph/sports/multi-sport-events/news/studio-23-to-become-an-all-sports-channel-on-free-tv-after-reformatting | title=Studio 23 to become an all-sports channel on free TV after reformatting | publisher=''[[Philippine Entertainment Portal|Sports Interactive Network Philippines]]'' | date=January 14, 2014 | accessdate=January 16, 2014 | author=Reuben Terrado}}</ref><ref name="Eunice Blanco">{{cite web | url=http://www.philstar.com/entertainment/2014/01/17/1279930/abs-cbn-turns-studio-23-sports-channel-launches-sports-action | title=ABS-CBN turns Studio 23 into sports channel, launches ‘Sports & Action’ | publisher=''[[The Philippine Star]]'' | date=January 17, 2014 | accessdate=January 17, 2014 | author=Eunice Blanco}}</ref> * January 18 – [[ABS-CBN]]'s new UHF sports channel on Channel 23, [[ABS-CBN Sports+Action|S+A]], was officially launched.<ref name="ABS 1">{{cite web | url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/sports/01/16/14/abs-cbn-launches-new-sports-channel | title=ABS-CBN launches new sports channel | publisher=''[[ABS-CBN News]]'' | date=January 16, 2014 | accessdate=January 16, 2014 | author=Dennis Gasgonia}}</ref><ref name="MB">{{cite web | url=http://www.mb.com.ph/abs-cbn-launches-sportsaction/ | title=ABS-CBN launches Sports+Action | publisher=''[[Manila Bulletin]]'' | date=January 17, 2014 | accessdate=January 17, 2014 | author=Rowena Tan | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140117071213/http://www.mb.com.ph/abs-cbn-launches-sportsaction/ | archivedate=January 17, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.abs-cbn.com/updates/PR-ABS-CBN-Sports-Action-All-New-Sports-Destination-For-Kapamilya-Sports-Fans?scid=9B864839-6F86-4D53-AB3C-9E75AFCDDA3D | title=ABS-CBN Sports+Action, All New Sports Destination For Kapamilya Sports Fans | publisher=''[[ABS-CBN Corporation]]'' | date=January 18, 2014 | accessdate=January 18, 2014 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140203004320/http://www.abs-cbn.com/updates/PR-ABS-CBN-Sports-Action-All-New-Sports-Destination-For-Kapamilya-Sports-Fans?scid=9B864839-6F86-4D53-AB3C-9E75AFCDDA3D# | archive-date=February 3, 2014 | dead-url=yes | df=mdy-all }}</ref> * January 22 – [[Vhong Navarro]] was beaten by Cedric Lee and five other men in a condominium unit after he was allegedly caught in the act of raping Deniece Cornejo, the occupant of the said condominium unit.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/346124/news/specialreports/the-vhong-navarro-case-timeline-of-events | title=The Vhong Navarro case: Timeline of events | publisher=''[[GMA News]]'' | date=January 29, 2014 | accessdate=March 4, 2014}}</ref> Navarro aired his side on the said incident in an interview by [[Boy Abunda]] for his program, ''[[The Buzz (talk show)|Buzz ng Bayan]]'', on January 26.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/focus/02/04/14/what-didnt-air-boys-interview-vhong# | title=What didn't air from Boy's interview with Vhong | publisher=''[[ABS-CBN News]]'' | date=February 4, 2014 | accessdate=March 4, 2014 | author=Andrew Jonathan Bagaoisan}}</ref> Last April 26, Lee together with his companion Simeon Raz was arrested by the NBI agents in [[Oras, Eastern Samar]], 1 week after the Taguig RTC issued warrants of arrests for the serious illegal detention case.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.tribune.net.ph/metro-section/fugitives-cedric-lee-pal-captured-in-samar-town| title=Fugitives Cedric Lee, pal captured in Samar town | publisher=''The Daily Tribune'' | date=April 27, 2014 | accessdate=April 27, 2014 | author=Jason Faustino}}</ref> On May 5, Cornejo surrendered to the authorities at the [[Philippine National Police]] headquarters in Camp Crame.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://entertainment.inquirer.net/141297/deniece-cornejo-in-police-custody | title=Deniece Cornejo surrenders | publisher=''[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]'' | date=May 5, 2014 | accessdate=May 5, 2014 | author=Julliane Love de Jesus}}</ref>
===February=== * February 1 – April Mariz ''Epey'' Herher won the hearts of judges, host and audience of the program ''It's Showtime'' after she named as the first grand winner of ''That's My Tomboy,'' a segment dedicated to lesbians.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/entertainment/02/01/14/mindoro-native-first-thats-my-tomboy-grand-winner | title=Mindoro native is first 'That's My Tomboy' grand winner | publisher=''ABS-CBN News'' | date=February 1, 2014 | accessdate=May 10, 2014}}</ref> * February 7 ** [[People's Television Network]], in partnership with HBKOR, Inc., announced that it will launch a talent search called ''K-Pop Idol Search (KIS) – Pinoy Edition.'' Preliminaries were held April to August 2014. The winner of the said competition will win two million [[Philippine peso|pesos]], a six-month intensive training in [[South Korea]], and a five-year exclusive performing contract.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.mb.com.ph/k-pop-idol-search-to-be-launched-soon/ | title=K-Pop Idol search to be launched soon | publisher=''[[Manila Bulletin]]'' | date=March 4, 2014 | accessdate=March 4, 2014 | author=Walden Sadiri M. Belen}}</ref><ref name="Hajji Kaamino">{{cite web | url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aAK9hBcTMKo | title=: K-Pop Idol Search 2014, isasahimpapawid ng Telebisyon ng Bayan | publisher=''[[People's Television Network]]'s [[News @ 1]]'' | date=February 14, 2014 | accessdate=March 18, 2014 | author=Hajji Kaamino | language=Filipino}}</ref> ** 14 people died, including 2 foreigners and comedian [[Tado Jimenez]], after a Florida bus with 45 passengers on-board fell into a 500-meter deep ravine in [[Bontoc, Mountain Province]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/575108/9-dead-as-bus-falls-into-mt-province-ravine | title=Comedian Tado Jimenez, 2 foreigners among 14 dead in Bontoc bus plunge | publisher=''[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]'' | work=[[Associated Press]] | date=February 7, 2014 | accessdate=February 7, 2014}}</ref> 24 others were reported injured, while four more passengers were reported missing.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/entertainment/02/07/14/tado-among-14-killed-bus-accident | title=Tado among 14 killed in bus accident | publisher=''[[ABS-CBN News]]'' | date=February 7, 2014 | accessdate=February 7, 2014}}</ref> * February 8 – [[Wally Bayola]] made a tearful return as one of the hosts of ''[[Eat Bulaga!]]'' after a 5-month hiatus due to a sex video scandal.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/entertainment/02/08/14/wally-bayola-makes-tearful-appearance-eat-bulaga | title=Wally makes tearful return to 'Eat Bulaga' | publisher=''[[ABS-CBN News]]'' | date=February 8, 2014 | accessdate=February 9, 2014}}</ref> * February 14 ** The revived local version of MTV in the country, [[MTV Pinoy]] was relaunched.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.philstar.com/entertainment/2014/02/12/1289240/what-expect-mtv-pinoy | title=What to expect from MTV Pinoy | publisher=''[[Philippine Star]]'' | date=February 12, 2014 | accessdate=February 12, 2014 | author=Baby A. Gil}}</ref> Sam Pinto, Andre Paras, singer Josh Padilla, and Yassi Pressman were also introduced as the channel's VJs.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.philstar.com/entertainment/2014/02/12/1289240/what-expect-mtv-pinoy | title=What to expect from MTV Pinoy | publisher=''[[The Philippine Star]]'' | date=February 12, 2014 | accessdate=March 4, 2014 | author=Baby A. GIl}}</ref> ** ''Manila Clasico'' Game 7 [[Philippine Basketball Association|PBA]] semi-finals match between [[Barangay Ginebra San Miguel]] and [[San Mig Super Coffee Mixers]] garnered the top spot as the most-watched primetime television program in [[Metro Manila]] by [[AGB Nielsen Philippines]] with a record-breaking 32% audience share in MEGATAM.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.interaksyon.com/interaktv/ginebra-san-mig-coffee-manila-clasico-game-seven-on-tv5-clobbers-abs-gma-in-ratings | title=Ginebra-San Mig Coffee Manila Clasico Game Seven on TV5 clobbers ABS, GMA in ratings | publisher=''[[Sports5]]'' | date=February 13, 2014 | accessdate=February 21, 2014 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222040302/http://www.interaksyon.com/interaktv/ginebra-san-mig-coffee-manila-clasico-game-seven-on-tv5-clobbers-abs-gma-in-ratings | archivedate=February 22, 2014 | df= }}</ref> * February 20 – The 10th USTv Students' Choice Awards. [[ABS-CBN]], and its programs and media personalities received 16 awards; [[GMA Network]], including its free news television channel [[GMA News TV]], received 9 awards; while [[TV5 (Philippines)|TV5]] received 1 award.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/entertainment/02/20/14/abs-cbn-wins-big-10th-ustv-awards | title=ABS-CBN wins big at 10th USTv awards | publisher=''[[ABS-CBN News]]'' | date=February 20, 2014 | accessdate=February 21, 2014 | author=Andrew Jonathan Bagaoisan}}</ref> * February 24 – ''[[Bandila (TV program)|Bandila]]'', a late night news program broadcast by [[ABS-CBN]], reported that two persons from Pangasinan were reported to have a flesh-eating disease and their disease is highly communicable. By February 25, the [[Department of Health (Philippines)|Department of Health]] (DOH) confirmed that the mysterious flesh-eating disease affecting two persons in the province of [[Pangasinan]] was a hoax. DOH also clarified that the two individuals were in fact affected by [[leprosy]], and a severe case of [[psoriasis]].<ref name="Philippine Daily Inquirer">{{cite web | url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/580801/abs-cbn-anchor-on-flesh-eating-disease-report-no-intention-to-sow-fear | title=ABS-CBN anchor on flesh-eating disease report: No intention to sow fear | publisher=''[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]'' | date=February 26, 2014 | accessdate=February 28, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.interaksyon.com/article/81519/epidemic-of-panic--feared-flesh-eating-disease-in-pangasinan-a-bad-case-of-psoriasis--doh | title=EPIDEMIC OF PANIC {{!}} Feared 'flesh-eating disease' in Pangasinan a bad case of psoriasis: DOH | publisher=''[[Interaksyon]]'' | date=February 25, 2014 | accessdate=February 28, 2014 | author=Jet Villa | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140302083105/http://www.interaksyon.com/article/81519/epidemic-of-panic--feared-flesh-eating-disease-in-pangasinan-a-bad-case-of-psoriasis--doh | archive-date=March 2, 2014 | dead-url=yes | df=mdy-all }}</ref> The news created fear among the public. It also became a hot topic online as the mysterious disease was said to be part of a prophecy by a self-titled Indian prophet Vincent Selvakumar of the Voice of Jesus Ministries who visited the country last April 2013. [[Julius Babao]], one of the anchors of the news program, later clarified on February 25 that it was not their intention to ignite fear among the public. He further added, ''It is not the program's intention to scare the public but to report the information we gathered so that authorities would give appropriate action.''<ref name="Philippine Daily Inquirer"/> On February 27, ABS-CBN issued an official statement that was broadcast on the same program apologizing for the fear and panic caused by the report that was broadcast on February 24. The network also added that their internal ombudsman office will look into the false report, and will take appropriate actions based on the findings of the network's ombudsman.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/video/nation/regions/02/27/14/bandila-statement-pangasinan-story | title='Bandila' statement on Pangasinan story | publisher=''[[ABS-CBN News]]'' | work=[[Bandila (TV program)|Bandila]] | date=February 27, 2014 | accessdate=February 28, 2014 | author=[[Julius Babao]]}}</ref> On February 28, the provincial government of Pangasinan demanded for an apology from ABS-CBN. The provincial government said that the false news report had greatly damaged the province's tourism sector.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.interaksyon.com/article/81699/pangasinan-demands-public-apology-from-abs-cbn-over-mysterious-disease-report | title=Pangasinan demands public apology from ABS-CBN over 'flesh-eating disease' report | publisher=''[[Interaksyon]]'' | work=[[Philippines News Agency]] | date=February 28, 2014 | accessdate=March 4, 2014 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140306031926/http://www.interaksyon.com/article/81699/pangasinan-demands-public-apology-from-abs-cbn-over-mysterious-disease-report | archive-date=March 6, 2014 | dead-url=yes | df=mdy-all }}</ref> * February 26 – ABS-CBN was the most awarded television network after receiving nine awards in the 49th Anvil Awards by the Public Relations Society of the Philippines (PRSP).<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.philstar.com/entertainment/2014/03/03/1296329/abs-cbn-most-awarded-network-49th-anvil-awards | title=ABS-CBN most awarded network at 49th Anvil Awards | publisher=''[[The Philippine Star]]'' | date=March 3, 2014 | accessdate=March 4, 2014}}</ref> [[GMA Network]]'s ''Dapat Tama'' electoral advocacy campaign also received an award in the said event.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://entertainment.tempo.com.ph/2014/03/gma7s-dapat-tama-campaign-wins-anvil-award/#.UxWG8fmSxcw | title=GMA7s’ ‘Dapat Tama campaign wins Anvil Award | publisher=''Tempo'' | date=March 4, 2014 | accessdate=March 4, 2014}}</ref>
===March=== * March 7 – GMA Network and ABS-CBN earned 11 and 5 nominations respectively in the 2014 New York Festivals International Television and Film Awards. The awards ceremony was held last April 8 (April 9; Philippine time) in [[Las Vegas, Nevada]], United States.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.pep.ph/guide/tv/13519/five-abs-cbn-entries-competing-in-2014-new-york-festivals-television-and-film-awards | title=Five ABS-CBN entries competing in 2014 New York Festivals Television and Film Awards | publisher=''[[Philippine Entertainment Portal]]'' | date=March 7, 2014 | accessdate=March 11, 2014}}</ref> * March 8 – Tearful [[Vhong Navarro]] returned to ''It's Showtime'' for more than a month of hiatus after recovering from injuries sustained following a mauling incident by six men in a condominium unit at The Fort, [[Taguig]] on January 22.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/video/entertainment/03/08/14/vhong-navarro-return-its-showtime-today | title=Vhong Navarro to return on 'It's Showtime' today | publisher=''[[ABS-CBN News]]'' | date=March 8, 2014 | accessdate=March 8, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/video/entertainment/03/08/14/watch-emotional-vhong-navarro-gives-speech-its-showtime | title=WATCH: Emotional Vhong Navarro gives speech on 'It's Showtime' | publisher=''[[ABS-CBN News]]'' | date=March 8, 2014 | accessdate=March 8, 2014}}</ref> * March 19 – [[TV5 (Philippines)|TV5]] news anchor [[Erwin Tulfo]] and [[DZBB-AM|GMA Super Radyo DZBB 594]] commentator Carmelo del Prado Magdurulan were named by the ''[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]'' as ''among the beneficiaries of the diversion of congressional allocations from the [[Priority Development Assistance Fund]] (PDAF)'' which was coursed through the National Agribusiness Corporation (Nabcor) in 2009. Both media men were reported to have received P245,535. Due to this, TV5 and GMA Network separately announced that they will be probing their respective broadcaters involved in the said allegations.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.pep.ph/news/42821/tv5-and-gma-network-to-probe-allegations-against-broadcasters | title=TV5 and GMA Network to probe allegations against broadcasters | publisher=''[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]'' | date=March 19, 2014 | accessdate=March 23, 2014 | author=Nerisa Almo}}</ref> * March 21 – GMA Network dominated the 5th Golden Screen Awards organized by the Entertainment Press Society as it bags the Outstanding TV Network award together with 27 other awards. ABS-CBN got home 24 awards while TV5 bagged away 2 awards.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.philstar.com/entertainment/2014/03/22/1303870/my-husbands-lover-dominates-5th-golden-screen-tv-awards | title='My Husband's Lover' dominates 5th Golden Screen TV Awards | publisher=''[[The Philippine Star]]'' | date=March 22, 2014 | accessdate=March 23, 2014}}</ref> * March 23 – GMA Network launched their own version of the Hollywood Walk of Fame called the "GMA Walk of Fame". Over 196 personalities and talents of the Kapuso Network both from the Entertainment and News and Public Affairs divisions had their own star at the Walk of Fame located at the network's compound in EDSA, Quezon City.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/354067/showbiz/gma-honors-kapuso-personalities-with-walk-of-fame | title=GMA honors Kapuso personalities with Walk of Fame | publisher=''[[GMA News]]'' | date=March 25, 2014 | accessdate=March 26, 2014}}</ref> * March 29 – [[Kapatid TV5]] International renewed their contract with [[OSN]], a pay TV network based in the Middle East and North Africa. Kapatid TV5 was named as the second top-rated Filipino international channel by OSN.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.mb.com.ph/tv5-international-one-upped-giants-in-middle-east-north-africa/ | title= TV5 international one-upped giants in Middle East, North Africa | publisher=''[[Manila Bulletin]]'' | date=March 29, 2014 | accessdate=April 6, 2014}}</ref> * March 30 – ABS-CBN formally launched this year's Station ID for the summer season called "Masayang Muli ang Kwento ng Summer" featuring the travel destinations, the culture and the smile of every Filipino. [[Kathryn Bernardo]] and [[Daniel Padilla]] rendered the song "PINASmile" which has been used for the station ID.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/video/entertainment/03/30/14/watch-abs-cbns-2014-summer-station-id | title=WATCH: ABS-CBN's 2014 summer station ID | publisher=''[[ABS-CBN News]]'' | date=March 30, 2014 | accessdate=March 30, 2014}}</ref>
===April=== * April 7 – [[Discovery Channel]]'s ''Manhunt'' series, starring ex-[[US Navy SEAL]] Joel Lambert, will feature the forest of [[Subic Bay Freeport Zone]], [[Olongapo City]]. Lambert will try to trek around the Subic tropical forest while evading capture by [[Philippine Scout Rangers]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://entertainment.inquirer.net/139068/ex-navy-seal-meets-match-in-ph-jungles | title=Ex-Navy SEAL meets match in PH jungles | publisher=''[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]'' | date=April 6, 2014 | accessdate=April 6, 2014 | author=Benedict S. Bartolome}}</ref> * April 9 ** GMA Network's daily docu-reality program ''[[Tunay Na Buhay]]'' episode entitled ''Sanggol at Langaw'' won the Gold Medal at the 2014 New York Festivals International TV and Film Awards. Six other GMA programs and plugs, and two ABS-CBN programs bagged the Silver and Bronze Medals, respectively.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/entertainment/gma/articles/2014-04-09/10227/Kapuso-programs-campaign-win-in-New-York-Festivals-Worlds-Best-TV-and-Films | title=Kapuso programs, campaign win in New York Festivals' World's Best TV and Films | publisher=''[[GMA Network]]'' | date=April 9, 2014 | accessdate=April 9, 2014 | language=Filipino}}</ref> ** Filipina models Katarina Rodriguez and Jodilly Pendre were named as the second and first runner-up of the ''[[Asia's Next Top Model (cycle 2)]]'' finale which was aired on [[Star World]]. Malaysian aspirant Sheena Liam was hailed as the winner of the said reality modelling competition. The show was also aired on [[TV5 (Philippines)|TV5]] in a delayed telecast.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.rappler.com/entertainment/news/55041-sheena-liam-asia-next-top-model-jodilly-pendre-katarina-rodriguez | title=2 Pinays runners-up to Sheena Liam in Asia's Next Top Model | publisher=''[[Rappler]]'' | date=April 9, 2014 | accessdate=April 10, 2014}}</ref> * April 23 – [[Department of Social Welfare and Development]] Secretary [[Dinky Soliman]] accused [[News5]], [[TV5 (Philippines)|TV5]]'s news division, of manipulating information of their unkempt DSWD warehouse (currently used for the World Food Programme) with rotten and spoiled relief goods in Brgy. Calibaan, [[Tacloban City]]. The report was aired last March 26 on ''[[Pilipinas News]]'', the network's late night newscast. In an official statement, TV5 stands for its story on the incident.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.dswd.gov.ph/2014/04/caibaan-warehouse-cited-by-tv5-not-dswds-sec-soliman-2/ | title=Caibaan warehouse cited by TV5, not DSWD's – Sec. Soliman | publisher=''[[Department of Social Welfare and Development (Philippines)]]'' | date=April 16, 2014 | accessdate=April 25, 2014 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140427002652/http://www.dswd.gov.ph/2014/04/caibaan-warehouse-cited-by-tv5-not-dswds-sec-soliman-2/ | archive-date=April 27, 2014 | dead-url=yes | df=mdy-all }}</ref> * April 26 – Bryan Castillo was named as the grand winner of the reality show ''[[The Biggest Loser Pinoy Edition: Doubles]]'' aired on [[ABS-CBN]]. Bryan, known as the ''Pride of Pembo, Makati'' and the member of Team MagKapatid now weighs in at 139 pounds from the former 293 pounds with a weight loss percentage of 52.56%. Kayen Lazaro, Francis Asis and Osie Nebreja were named as the 1st, 2nd and 3rd runner up, respectively.<ref name="Biggest Loser">{{cite web | url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/entertainment/04/26/14/pride-pembo-named-biggest-loser | title='Pride of Pembo' named 'Biggest Loser' | publisher=''[[ABS-CBN News]]'' | date=April 26, 2014 | accessdate=May 3, 2014}}</ref> * April 29 – ABS-CBN (both for television and radio, and the Manila and Regional Network Group stations) won major awards at the 22nd KBP Golden Dove Awards with 22 awards including Best TV station and the KBP Lifetime Achievement Award given to the network's chairman, Eugenio Lopez III. TV5 only got 2 awards for ''[[Pinoy Explorer]]'' (Best TV Magazine Program) and [[Ogie Alcasid]] of ''[[Tropa Mo Ko Unli]]'' (Best Comedy Actor). Pampanga-based TV network [[CLTV-36]] was awarded for the second time as the Best Provincial TV station.<ref name="KBP">{{cite web|url=http://www.mb.com.ph/joel-torre-boots-anson-roa-win-big-at-golden-dove-awards/ |title=Joel Torre, Boots Anson-Roa win big at Golden Dove Awards |publisher=''[[Manila Bulletin]]'' |date=April 30, 2014 |accessdate=May 1, 2014 |author=Rowena Tan |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140505021511/http://www.mb.com.ph/joel-torre-boots-anson-roa-win-big-at-golden-dove-awards/ |archivedate=May 5, 2014 }}</ref>
===May=== * May 5 ** Documentarist [[Howie Severino]] named as the Vice President for Professional Development of GMA News after he resigning as the VP for Multimedia Journalism of GMA Network and the editor-in-chief of GMA News Online. Severino will keep his job as the host of ''[[I-Witness]]'' and anchor of ''[[News to Go]]''.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.rappler.com/nation/56525-howie-severino-steps-down-gma-news-online-chief| title=Howie Severino steps down as GMA News Online chief | publisher=''[[Rappler]]'' | date=April 27, 2014 | accessdate=April 28, 2014}}</ref> ** GMA Network chairman and CEO Atty. Felipe L. Gozon confirms the network stockholders is in negotiations with [[San Miguel Corporation]] chairman Ramon Ang who is interested to buy the equity stake of the network.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/359616/economy/companies/gma-is-in-talks-with-san-miguel-corp-s-ramon-ang-says-chairman-and-ceo-gozon | title=GMA is in talks with San Miguel Corp.'s Ramon Ang, says Chairman and CEO Gozon | publisher=''[[GMA News]]'' | date=May 5, 2014 | accessdate=May 5, 2014}}</ref> * May 8–10 – Advertising and Marketing companies will joined together for the staging of the first AD Summit Pilipinas 2014 with the theme, entitled ''Age of Enlightenment'', and the Kidlat Awards that will recognized the achievements of advertising industry in 2013. The convention was held at the Subic Bay Exhibition and Convention Center in Subic, Zambales. TV5, [[Radio Mindanao Network|RMN]], [[Manila Broadcasting Company|MBC]] and ABS-CBN are the major sponsors of the said event to be organized by Accredited Advertising Agencies of the Philippines and Advertising Suppliers Association of the Philippines.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://adobomagazine.com/philippine-news/ad-summit-pilipinas-day-1-all-roads-lead-subic | title=AD SUMMIT PILIPINAS DAY 1: ALL ROADS LEAD TO SUBIC | publisher=''Adobo Magazine'' | date=May 5, 2014 | accessdate=May 7, 2014}}</ref> * May 10 – Baguio-based John Raspado, formerly one of the wildcard contestants of the contest was hailed as the grand winner of ''I Am Pogay'' segment of the noontime show It's Showtime aired on ABS-CBN, the contest on TV for gay men.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/entertainment/05/10/14/baguio-city-underdog-first-pogay-grand-winner | title=Baguio City underdog is first 'Pogay' grand winner | publisher=''ABS-CBN News'' | date=May 10, 2014 | accessdate=May 10, 2014}}</ref> * May 18 – News personalities [[Mike Enriquez]], [[Luchi Cruz-Valdez|Luchi Cruz-Valdes]], and [[Korina Sanchez]] both denied their links in to the Pork Barrel scam controversy of Janet Lim Napoles.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2014/05/19/1324858/korina-mike-enriquez-deny-receiving-cash-gifts-napoles | title=Korina, Mike Enriquez deny receiving cash gifts from Napoles | publisher=''Philippine Star'' | date=May 19, 2014 | accessdate=May 19, 2014}}</ref> * May 19 – [[GMA News]]'s special coverage (consisting of ''[[24 Oras]]'', ''[[State of the Nation with Jessica Soho]]'', ''[[Saksi]]'', ''[[24 Oras|24 Oras Weekend]]'' and ''[[Kapuso Mo, Jessica Soho]]'') of the aftermath of [[Typhoon Yolanda]] that hit several parts of the [[Visayas]] region last November 2013 to be awarded as one of the 46 winners of the George's Foster [[Peabody Awards]] to be held in New York City. This is the fourth time that a Philippine TV network was recognized by the [[Peabody Awards]]. ''[[I-Witness]]'' documentaries ''Kidneys for Sale'' (2000), ''Kamao'' (2000) and ''Ambulansya de Paa'' (2009), [[Brigada Siete]] feature on Child Labor (2000) and Reel Time's ''Salat'' (2013) were former recipients of the award.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/355217/news/nation/gma-news-coverage-of-supertyphoon-yolanda-wins-peabody-award | title=GMA News' Coverage of Supertyphoon Yolanda wins Peabody Award | publisher=''[[GMA News]]'' | date=April 2, 2014 | accessdate=April 3, 2014}}</ref> * May 22 – GMA Network won the Outstanding TV Station of the year of the 34th Rotary Club of Manila Journalism Awards. * May 30 – ABS-CBN (Gold Services Company of the Year Award) and its president and CEO Charo Santos-Concio (Woman of the Year for the Philippines) emerged as the lone Philippine winner of the Asia-Pacific Stevie Awards held at South Korea.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://dzmm.abs-cbnnews.com/news/Entertainment/Charo_Santos-Concio,_ABS-CBN,_pinarangalan_sa_Asia-Pacific_Stevie_Awards.html | title=Charo Santos-Concio, ABS-CBN, pinarangalan sa Asia-Pacific Stevie Awards | publisher=''[[DZMM.com.ph]]'' | language=Filipino | date=May 31, 2014 | accessdate=June 3, 2014}}</ref>
===June=== * June 1 – The premiere telecast of ''It Takes Gutz to be A Gutierrez'', the first reality TV show based on the one of the prominent showbiz families in the country, the Gutierrezes aired on E! Channel Asia. In the pilot episode of the Mike Carandang-directed program, [[Richard Gutierrez]] confirms that his partner [[Sarah Lahbati]] gave birth to a baby boy named ''Zion''.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.philstar.com/entertainment/2014/06/02/1330178/richard-gutierrez-admits-having-baby-sarah-lahbati | title=Richard Gutierrez admits having baby with Sarah Lahbati | publisher=''[[Philippine Star]]'' | date=June 2, 2014 | accessdate=June 2, 2014}}</ref> * June 2 ** [[Asian Television Content Corporation]] (ATC) started their blocktime agreement for [[Intercontinental Broadcasting Corporation]] (IBC Channel 13), fifth time for the network (with former blocktime deals from Vintage, Viva, Makisig (discontinued and not aired) and AKTV). ATC will supply quality alternative programming for the government-sequestred TV network.<ref name="ATC">{{cite web | url=http://manilastandardtoday.com/mobile/2014/04/26/channel-13-back-in-harness/ | title=Channel 13 back in harness | publisher=''[[Manila Standard Today]]'' | date=April 26, 2014 | accessdate=May 8, 2014}}</ref> ** In line with their 40th anniversary in the television industry, [[People's Television Network]] Channel 4's newscasts (Balitaan, PTV NewsBreak, News @ 1, News @ 6, NewsLife, The Weekend News) will be reformatted with new titlecards, new graphic designs and a brand new studio set design by Extremity Arts. * June 4 – For the fourth straight time, GMA Network's First Vice President for News Programs and State of the Nation anchor [[Jessica Soho]] was recognized as the Most Trusted News Presenter in the Philippines by Reader's Digest Asia. * June 11 – The [[Movie and Television Review and Classification Board]] ordered [[ABS-CBN]] to attend a mandatory conference on the gender sensitivity issues for their reality show ''[[Pinoy Big Brother: All In]]''. The Philippine Commission on Women condemned the June 4 episode on the nude painting task given for 4 housemates of the program, Jayme Jalandoni, Ranty Portento, Daniel Matsunaga and Michele Gumabao.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/364951/showbiz/mtrcb-orders-abs-cbn-to-explain-nude-painting-challenge-in-reality-show | title=MTRCB orders ABS-CBN to explain 'nude painting challenge' in reality show | publisher=''[[GMA News]]'' | date=June 10, 2014 | accessdate=June 11, 2014}}</ref> Jayme, Ranty and Michele was part of the evictees from the reality show. * June 13 – ABS-CBN won the Award of Excellence at recent IABC's International Gold Quill Awards 2014 for their advocacy of the restoration of Philippine classic films. The awards were held in [[Toronto|Toronto, Ontario, Canada]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.philstar.com/entertainment/2014/06/15/1334847/abs-cbn-wins-intl-gold-quill-restoring-pinoy-film-classics | title=ABS-CBN wins int'l Gold Quill for restoring Pinoy film classics | publisher=''[[The Philippine Star]]'' | date=June 15, 2014 | accessdate=June 18, 2014}}</ref> * June 14 – Veteran actress [[Boots Anson-Roa]] tied the knot once again, now together with his new fiancé Atty. King Rodrigo in a wedding ceremony led by Arch. Luis Antonio Cardinal Tagle at the Archbishop's Palace in Manila.<ref name="Boots">{{cite web | url=https://ph.celebrity.yahoo.com/news/boots-anson-roa-ties-the-knot-for-the-second-time-102305518.html | title=Boots Anson-Roa ties the knot for the second time | publisher=''[[Yahoo!]]'' | date=June 14, 2014 | accessdate=June 15, 2014}}</ref> * June 16 – Brigada's ''Gintong Burak'' episode won the One World Award, the highest recognition of the USIFVF for the Philippine television. That said episode, together with Wagas, both from [[GMA News TV]], was awarded the Gold Camera Award in the 2014 US International Film & Video Festival, GMA News and Public Affairs, likewise won five silver screen awards and one certificate of excellence awards. ABS-CBN also got 2 awards.<ref name="US Film">{{cite web | url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/corporate/articles/2014-06-14/121/GMA-Network-trumps-ABS-CBN-in-2014-US-International-Film-Video-Festival | title=GMA Network trumps ABS-CBN in 2014 US International Film & Video Festival | publisher=''[[GMA Network]]'' | date=June 14, 2014 | accessdate=June 15, 2014}}</ref> * June 18 – StarStruck batch 5 alumnus [[Steven Silva]] and Save Me Hollywood vocalist/I Am Meg Season 1 winner Julz Savard will become the cast members of ''The Boston'', the second season of ''The Kitchen Musical''. Some of the scenes of the drama will be shot in Manila. The show will be aired on [[Lifestyle (TV channel)|Lifestyle]] and will be also aired internationally.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.mb.com.ph/steven-silva-lone-kapuso-cast-in-the-boston/ | title=Steven Silva lone Kapuso cast in ‘The Boston’ | publisher=''[[Manila Bulletin]]'' | date=May 10, 2014 | accessdate=May 10, 2014}}</ref> * June 22 – MTRCB praised Fox International Channels, the cable TV channels group and distributor of the hit American TV series ''[[The Walking Dead (TV series)|The Walking Dead]]'' on their self-regulation by airing warnings during the show. MTRCB chairman Toto Villareal, together with the board members and FIC VP Jude Turcuato attended the meeting at the FIC headquarters in Taguig City.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://entertainment.inquirer.net/145438/mtrcb-commends-cable-channels-self-regulation-on-walking-dead-series | title=MTRCB commends cable channel's self-regulation on ‘Walking Dead’ series| publisher=''[[Philippine Daily Inquirer]]'' | date=June 23, 2014 | accessdate=June 23, 2014}}</ref> * June 24 – [[GMA Network]], through a group of stockholders, the Duavit, Jimenez and the Gozon families have decided to sell their minority equity interest in the Company's outstanding capital stock to [[San Miguel Corporation]] president [[Ramon S. Ang]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/corporate/articles/2014-06-24/123/GMA-Network-Inc.-to-sell-minority-stake-to-Ramon-Ang | title=GMA Network Inc. to sell minority stake to Ramon Ang | publisher=''[[GMA Network]]'' | date=June 24, 2014 | accessdate=June 24, 2014}}</ref> * June 25–26 – [[DWAO-TV|UNTV 37]] will celebrate its first decade on the air. The TV station pioneered free public service programs to the public and the use of its rescue team and UV drones is backed by [[Daniel Razon]], popularly known as ''Kuya Daniel'' or as ''Mr. Public Service''.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://entertainment.tempo.com.ph/2014/06/untv-celebrates-10th-year/#.U5riGJSSwqM | title=UNTV celebrates 10th year | publisher=''Tempo'' | date=June 9, 2014 | accessdate=June 13, 2014}}</ref> * June 25 – TV5 presents to the advertisers their newest programming line-up for the 3rd quarter in 2014 during the ''Signal No. 5: Umuulan ng Saya'' trade launch at the Manila Polo Club.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.philstar.com/entertainment/2014/06/30/1340599/its-raining-fun-tv5s-signal-no.-5 | title=It's raining fun in TV5's Signal No. 5 | publisher=''Philippine Star'' | date=June 30, 2014 | accessdate=July 11, 2014}}</ref> * June 26 – Mayor Herbert Bautista, Architect Bong Recio, PBC Pres. Atom Henares and UNTV-BMPI CEO Daniel Razon led groundbreaking of the soon-to-rise 18-storey UNTV Broadcast Center located a few meters away from the current UNTV building in EDSA Philam Homes, Quezon City. The building will be completed in January 2016.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.mb.com.ph/iconic-untv-building-soon-to-rise/ | title=Iconic UNTV building soon to rise | publisher=''Manila Bulletin'' | date=June 9, 2014 | accessdate=July 11, 2014 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150221073309/http://www.mb.com.ph/iconic-untv-building-soon-to-rise/ | archivedate=February 21, 2015 | df= }}</ref>
===July=== * July 1 – Veteran journalist [[Jessica Soho]] has retired from her post as the first vice president for news programs for GMA News. Soho will keep her job as the host of ''[[Kapuso Mo, Jessica Soho]]'' and anchor of ''[[State of the Nation with Jessica Soho]]''. * July 9 – Game 5 of the 2014 PBA Governor's Cup Finals between Grand slam champions San Mig Coffee Mixers and Rain or Shine Elasto Painters gained an average of 4 million viewers or 9.5 percent AMR and 34 percent audience share in the National Urban TV Audience Measurement (NUTAM) in the primetime slot, based on Nielsen Media Research.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.spin.ph/sports/basketball/news/game-five-between-san-mig-rain-or-shine-watched-by-average-of-four-million-viewers-over-tv5 | title=Game Five between San Mig, Rain or Shine watched by average of four million viewers over TV5 | publisher=''Spin.ph'' | date=July 11, 2014 | accessdate=July 11, 2014}}</ref> * July 12 – [[Christian Broadcasting Network|Christian Broadcasting Network Asia]] and ABS-CBN signed a contract to air the bible-based animated series ''[[Superbook]]'' on the Yes Weekend! morning line-up. Christian Broadcasting Network Asia President Peter Kairuz and ABS-CBN Head of TV Production Cory Vidanes graced the contract signing.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://cbnasia.org/home/2014/07/superbook-is-now-an-official-kapamilya/ | title=Superbook Is Now An Official Kapamilya! | publisher=''CBN Asia'' | accessdate=July 11, 2014}}</ref> * July 14 – The ''Boycott Sofitel'' and "No To Sofitel" campaign was launched by the supporters of UNTV and [[Daniel Razon]] due to intentional delisting of the channel in their hotel cable line-up, among other reasons.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.localpulse.net/twitter-popular/notosofitel-untv-boycotts-sofitel-media-discrimination-2143/| title=#NoToSofitel: UNTV Boycotts Sofitel For Media Discrimination | publisher=''Local Pulse'' | accessdate=July 14, 2014}}</ref> * July 19 – Ilocana beauty Chatterlie Mae Umalos was crowned the first ever grand finals winner of ''Gandang Babae 2014'' during a live episode of It's Showtime.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/entertainment/07/19/14/ilocano-beauty-wins-gandang-babae-2014 | title=Ilocana beauty wins Gandang Babae 2014 | publisher=''[[ABS CBN News]]'' | accessdate=July 19, 2014}}</ref> * July 27 ** Team Sarah [[Lyca Gairanod]] won the first season of ''[[The Voice Kids (Philippine TV series)|The Voice Kids]]'' after their successful finale at the Resorts World Manila.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.rappler.com/entertainment/news/64496-the-voice-kids-winner-2014 | title=Lyca Gairanod wins 'The Voice Kids' | publisher=''Rappler'' | date=July 27, 2014 | accessdate=August 3, 2014}}</ref> ** TV5 news anchor [[Paolo Bediones]] was the latest victim of a sex video scandal with an unknown woman spreading thru social media and became a trending topic on Twitter.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/372190/showbiz/chikaminute/tv5-xbacks-paolo-bediones-amid-alleged-sex-video-scandal | title=TV5 backs Paolo Bediones amid alleged sex video scandal | publisher=''GMA News'' | accessdate=July 28, 2014}}</ref> * July 28 – PTV 4 and IBC 13 employees staged their protest at the Commonwealth Avenue in time for the PNoy's State of the Nation Address. * July 30 – ''[[Eat Bulaga!]]'', the [[Philippines]] longest running noontime show, celebrated its 35th year on Philippine Television.
===August=== * August 9 – Celebrity couple [[Dingdong Dantes]] and [[Marian Rivera]] was engaged after their marriage proposal during the live telecast birthday special of ''[[Marian (variety show)|Marian]]'' aired on [[GMA Network]]. Their wedding will be set on December 30, 2014 in the Immaculate Conception Cathedral in Cubao, Quezon City.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.mb.com.ph/dingdong-proposes-to-marian-on-national-tv/ | title= Dingdong proposes to Marian on national TV | publisher=''[[Manila Bulletin]]'' | date=August 9, 2014 | accessdate=August 9, 2014 | author=Pau Aguilera}}</ref> * August 23 – [[9TV]] is the network was launched. * August 24 – Brazilian-Japanese model and actor [[Daniel Matsunaga]] was chosen by the voting public to become the Big Winner of ''[[Pinoy Big Brother: All In]]'' in the Big Night held at the [[Resorts World Manila]] and aired on [[ABS-CBN]]. Matsunaga won P1M cash and other prizes including Asian Trip for 2 and a condo unit. Maris Racal, Jane Oineza and Vickie Rushton were named as the 2nd, 3rd and 4th placers respectively.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://ph.celebrity.yahoo.com/news/daniel-matsunaga-is--pbb--all-in--big-winner-214526874.html | title=Daniel Matsunaga is 'PBB: All In' big winner | publisher=''Yahoo! Celebrity'' | date=August 25, 2014 | accessdate=August 26, 2014 | author=Karen Valeza}}</ref> * August 29 ** [[ABS-CBN]] bagged another Stevie award for Company of the Year – Media & Entertainment, the third Stevie award bagged by ABS-CBN for 2014. ** [[Sharon Cuneta]] ends her 2-year contract with TV5. Her last program with the network was ''[[Madam chairman]]'' which ended last January.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://entertainment.inquirer.net/151038/sharon-cuneta-leaves-tv5-source | title=Sharon Cuneta leaves TV5| publisher=''Philippine Daily Inquirer'' | date=August 29, 2014 | accessdate=August 29, 2014 | author=Bayani San Diego}}</ref>
===September=== * September 1 – [[Jack City]] was no longer aired on BEAM Channel 31 as BEAM prepares for the ISDB-T digital television.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/business/tech-biz/08/05/14/beam-upgrades-transmitters-support-digital-tv|title=BEAM upgrades transmitters to support digital TV|work=ABS-CBN News}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.globe.com.ph/press-room/beam-supports-ntc|title=BEAM supports NTC's shift to digital TV|work=globe.com.ph}}</ref> However, Jack City continues to broadcast on cable networks. After its closure, it aired [[O Shopping]] and [[Trinity Broadcasting Network|TBN]] which its started from 9:00 am of the date mentioned above. * September 3 – Sec. Sonny Coloma in the hearing for the 2015 PCOO Senate budget and GCG Adisclosed that efforts to privatize IBC-13 will continue next year despite legal obstacles. Escudero suggest to Congress to allocate subsidy for unpaid GSIS, SSS, PhilHealth contributions of the network employees.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.philstar.com/business/2014/09/22/1371952/ibc-13-faces-privatization | title=IBC-13 faces privatization | publisher=''[[Philippine Star]]'' | date=September 22, 2014 | accessdate=September 25, 2014}}</ref> * September 7 ** [[Billy Crawford]] was arrested after his drunk behavior at the Taguig Police Station 7, happened hours after the Star Magic Ball when Crawford was the guest. Billy was apologized to the police and the fans. The following day, Crawford post bail on his Malicious Mischief case.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/378179/showbiz/billy-crawford-charged-with-malicious-mischief-disobedience-to-person-in-authority | title=Billy Crawford charged with malicious mischief, disobedience to person in authority | publisher=''[[GMA Network]]'' | date=September 8, 2014 | accessdate=September 8, 2014}}</ref> * September 25 – [[Richard Yap]] and [[Jodi Sta. Maria]] officially announced in their press conference that ABS-CBN's morning drama ''[[Be Careful with My Heart]]'' will officially end on November 28 after their successful 2-year run.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://dzmm.abs-cbnnews.com/news/Entertainment/%27Be_Careful_With_My_Heart%27%2C_magtatapos_na_sa_Nov._28.html | title='Be Careful with My Heart', magtatapos na sa Nov. 28 | publisher=''[[DZMM TeleRadyo]]'' | date=September 25, 2014 | accessdate=September 25, 2014 | language=Filipino}}</ref>
===October=== * October 1 – [[TV Patrol|TV Patrol Weekend]]'s coverage on the onslaught of Typhoon Yolanda was recognized as the nominee for the News category of the 2014 International Emmy Awards. * October 12 – [[Valerie Weigmann]] was declared the winner of [[Miss World Philippines 2014]], crowned by outgoing titleholder and current [[Miss World 2013|Miss World]], [[Megan Young]] at the [[Mall of Asia Arena]]. She will be competing on December 14 in London for the [[Miss World 2014]] crown.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.philstar.com/entertainment/2014/10/13/1379700/valerie-weigmann-crowned-miss-world-philippines-2014 | title=Valerie Weigmann crowned Miss World Philippines 2014 | publisher=''[[The Philippine Star]]'' | date=October 13, 2014 | accessdate=October 13, 2014 | author=Chuck Smith}}</ref> * October 14 – ABS-CBN scored yet another Stevie award for People's Choice Stevie Award for Media & Entertainment, the fourth Stevie award bagged by ABS-CBN in 2014.
===November=== * November 10 – As part of [[GMA News and Public Affairs|GMA News]] shakeup, [[Vicky Morales]] joined the [[24 Oras]] team as its third anchor. Also, GMA Regional newscasts for [[DWAI-TV|Bicol]], [[DYSS-TV|Cebu]], [[DXMJ-TV|Davao]], [[DXDZ-TV|Northern Mindanao]], [[DYXX-TV|Iloilo]], [[DWGD-TV|Dagupan]] and [[DWAS-TV|Ilocos]] adopted the 24 Oras branding. Along with [[Saksi]] and [[Balitanghali]], the graphic package went flat, also their title cards, the return of the Myriad font for 24 Oras, and the OBB, along with its energetic theme music. * November 20 – More than 200 talents of GMA Network, members of the Talents Association of GMA filed a complaint against the network following the network's stand for refusal for them to become regular employees even the Project Employment Contract with benefits deal will present to them. * November 23 – ABS-CBN dominated 32 categories, including Best TV Station, in the recently concluded 28th [[PMPC Star Awards for TV 2014]] held at the Solaire Resort and Casino.
===December=== * December 30 – Kapuso power couple [[Marian Rivera]] and [[Dingdong Dantes]] are now married in a Wedding ceremony at the [[Cubao Cathedral|Immaculate Conception Cathedral]] in Cubao, [[Quezon City]]. President [[Benigno Aquino III]], [[Ogie Alcasid]], German Moreno, [[Vic Sotto]] and GMA Network CEO chairman Atty. Felipe L. Gozon also attended the wedding.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://entertainment.inquirer.net/159523/dingdong-dantes-marian-rivera-royal-wedding-in-photos | title=Dingdong Dantes-Marian Rivera ‘royal wedding’ in photos | publisher=''[[Philippine Daily Inquirer|Inquirer]]'' | date=December 30, 2014 | accessdate=December 30, 2014}}</ref>

Inquirer]]'' | date=May 15, 2014 | accessdate=May 15, 2014}}</ref> * September 1: [[Mark Gil]], (born 1961), 52, actor, liver cirrosis.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.rappler.com/entertainment/news/67829-veteran-actor-mark-gil-dies | title=Veteran actor Mark Gil dies | publisher=''[[Rappler]]'' | date=September 1, 2014 | accessdate=September 1, 2014}}</ref> * September 19: Zenaida Sison, 75, Mother of actress [[Cherry Pie Picache]], stab wound.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/380714/news/metromanila/nbi-takes-on-case-of-death-of-cherry-pie-picache-s-mom | title=NBI takes on case of death of Cherry Pie Picache's mom | publisher=''[[GMA News]]'' | date=September 24, 2014 | accessdate=September 24, 2014}}</ref> * October 2: Myrna "Tiya Pusit" Villanueva, (born 1948), 66, Filipina comedian and actress, aortic aneurysm and kidney failure.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/381934/showbiz/chikaminute/comedienne-tiya-pusit-passes-away | title=Comedienne Tiya Pusit passes away | publisher=''[[GMA News]]'' | date=October 3, 2014 | accessdate=October 3, 2014}}</ref> * November 5: Elaine Gamboa Cuneta, (born 1934), 79, former beauty queen, singer, and actress, stomach ulcer.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/386705/showbiz/chikaminute/elaine-gamboa-cuneta-sharon-s-mom-kc-s-grandma-passes-away | title=Elaine Gamboa-Cuneta, Sharon's mom, KC's grandma, passes away | publisher=''[[GMA News]]'' | date=November 5, 2014 | accessdate=November 6, 2014}}</ref> * November 15: Raffy Marcelo (born 1946), 67, anchor of [[GMA News and Public Affairs|GMA News]], cardiac arrest.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/388434/lifestyle/peopleandevents/raffy-marcelo-1946-2014 | title=Raffy Marcelo, 1946 – 2014 | publisher=''[[GMA News]]'' | {{YYYY music|2018}} {{Year nav topic5|2018|Danish music}}
The following is a list of notable events and releases of the year '''2018 in [[Music of Denmark|Danish music]]'''.
==Events== <!--ALL EVENTS MUST BE SOURCED. Album releases, band breakups do not go in this section-->
===January===
===February=== * '''10''' – The artist and song for Denmark in the [[Eurovision Song Contest 2018]] will be decided.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://eurovisionworld.com/?eurovision=2018denmark | title=Eurovision 2018 Denmark | publisher=EurovisionWorld.com | accessdate=2017-10-22}}</ref>
===March===
===April===
===May=== * '''30''' – The 20th [[Copenhagen Distortion|Distortion]] festival start in [[Copenhagen]] (May 30 - June 3).<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ringrocker.com/festivals.php?op=showf&copenhagen-distortion-2018&fid=4976 | title=Copenhagen Distortion 2018 | website=RingRocker.com | accessdate=2017-10-22}}</ref>
===June=== * '''9''' – The [[NorthSide Festival (Denmark)|NorthSide Festival]] opens in [[Aarhus]] (June 9 - 11).<ref>{{cite web | url=http://northside.dk | title=NorthSide 7. - 9. 2018 | publisher=[[NorthSide Festival (Denmark)]] | accessdate=2017-01-22}}</ref> * '''21''' – The 9th [[Copenhell]] festival start in [[Copenhagen]] (June 21 - 23).<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.copenhell.dk | title=Copenhell - See You June 21, 22, 23 2018 | publisher=[[Copenhell]] | accessdate=2017-01-22}}</ref> * '''28''' – The 4th Tinderbox Festival start in [[Odense]] (June 28 - 30).<ref>{{cite web | url=https://tinderbox.dk | title=Tinderbox | publisher=Tinderbox.dk | accessdate=2017-01-22}}</ref>
===July=== * '''4''' – The 47th [[Roskilde Festival]] opens (July 4 - 7).<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.kultunaut.dk/perl/arrmore/type-nynaut?ArrNr=196040 | title=Roskilde Festival 2018 | publisher=Kultunaut.dk | accessdate=2017-10-21}}</ref> * '''6''' – The 38th [[Copenhagen Jazz Festival]] start in [[Copenhagen, Denmark]] (July 6 – 15).<ref>{{cite web | url=http://jazz.dk/en/copenhagen-jazz-festival-2018/frontpage | title=Copenhagen Jazz Festival July 6–15, 2018 | publisher=[[Copenhagen Jazz Festival]] | accessdate=2017-10-21}}</ref> * '''11''' – [[G! Festival]] opens in Göta, [[Eysturoy]], [[Faroe Islands]] (July 11 - 14).<ref>{{cite web |url=https://gfestival.fo | title=G! | publisher=[[G! Festival]] | accessdate=2018-03-04}}</ref> * '''14''' – The 30th [[Aarhus Jazz Festival]] start (July 14 - 21).<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.visitaarhus.dk/aarhus-jazz-festival-2018-gdk603889 | title=Aarhus Jazz Festival 2018 | publisher=VisitAarhus.dk | accessdate=2017-10-22}}</ref>
===August=== * '''8''' – The Strøm Fesatival start in Copenhagen (August 8 - 11).<ref>{{cite web | url=http://stromcph.dk/festival | title=Strøm Fesatival 8-11 Aug 2018 | publisher=Stromcph.dk | accessdate=2017-10-22}}</ref>
===September=== * '''5''' – The Copenhagen World Music Festival start (September 5 - 9).<ref>{{cite web | url=http://cphworld.dk | title=The Copenhagen World Music Fesatival | publisher=CphWorld.dk | accessdate=2017-10-22}}</ref>
==Albums released== === February === {|class="wikitable" |- !Day !Album !Artist !Label !Notes !Ref. |- | rowspan="1" style="text-align:center;"|23 | ''Pilgrim'' | [[Janne Mark]] with [[Arve Henriksen]] | [[ACT Music|ACT]] | Produced by Esben Eyermann and Janne Mark | style="text-align:center;"|<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.actmusic.com/en/Artists/Janne-Mark/Pilgrim/Pilgrim-CD | title=Janne Mark: Pilgrim - CD | publisher=[[ACT Music]] | accessdate=2018-02-28}}</ref> |}
=== March === {|class="wikitable" |- !Day !Album !Artist !Label !Notes !Ref. |- | rowspan="1" style="text-align:center;"|23 | ''Returnings'' | [[Jakob Bro]] with [[Palle Mikkelborg]], [[Thomas Morgan (bassist)|Thomas Morgan]], and [[Jon Christensen]] | [[ECM Records|ECM]] | Produced by [[Manfred Eicher]] | style="text-align:center;"|<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.ecmrecords.com/catalogue/1516173984/returnings-jakob-bro | title=Jakob Bro - Returnings | publisher=[[ECM Records]] | accessdate=2018-02-28}}</ref> |}
=== October === {|class="wikitable" |- !Day !Album !Artist !Label !Notes !Ref. |- | rowspan="1" style="text-align:center;"|5 | ''Bay Of Rainbows'' | [[Jakob Bro]], [[Thomas Morgan (bassist)|Thomas Morgan]], and [[Joey Baron]] | [[ECM Records]] | | style="text-align:center;"|<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.ecmrecords.com/catalogue/1534427955/bay-of-rainbows-jakob-bro-thomas-morgan-joey-baron | title=Bay Of Rainbows — Jakob Bro, Thomas Morgan, Joey Baron | website=[[ECM Records]] | accessdate=2018-11-07}}</ref> |}
== Deaths ==
; January * '''1''' – [[Teddy Edelmann]], singer (born 1941).<ref>{{cite web | url=http://nyheder.tv2.dk/samfund/2018-01-01-teddy-edelmann-er-doed | title=Teddy Edelmann er død | language=da | publisher=Nyheder.tv2.dk | accessdate=2018-01-24}}</ref>
; August * '''16''' – [[Benny Andersen]], writer and pianist (born 1929).<ref>{{cite web | url=https://politiken.dk/kultur/art6664988/Forfatteren-Benny-Andersen-er-d%C3%B8d | title=Forfatteren Benny Andersen er død | language=da | publisher=[[Politiken]] |date=2018-08-17 | accessdate=2018-09-23}}</ref>
; October * '''30''' – [[Kim Larsen]], rock singer and guitarist, [[Gasolin']] (born 1945).
